alert.note: Alert for Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 23 at 9:40AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Chena River from North Pole upstream to its headwaters * WHEN...Until 1000 AM AKDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding is occuring in low-lying or flood prone areas along Chena Hot Springs Road. High water and minor flooding is also expected in the Steamboat Landing area near North Pole. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 917 AM AKDT, Runoff from snowmelt continues to move down the Chena River. The higher elevation snowpack has diminished considerably over the past few days and water levels will gradually fall later this week. - The surge of high water on the Chena River will move downriver over the next 24 hours. - Please stay tuned to NOAA weather radio or your favorite local weather news source for updates on this situation. - If you live near or along the Chena River upstream of North Pole stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
